alert.note: Alert for Castle Country; San Rafael Swell (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 2:47PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Emery County through 330 PM MDT... At 246 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 28 miles southeast of Clawson, or 31 miles west of Green River, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Emery County. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 106 and 158. US Route 6 between mile markers 285 and 300. Utah Route 24 between mile markers 146 and 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
